qas.question: What battle ended a British invasion from Canada in the Revolutionary War?
When was the battle of Saratoga fought?
What Prussian expatriate helped train the Continental army?
What two European countries entered the Revolutionary War against Britain?
What advantage did Britain lose when the European countries entered the war?
What battle ended a British invasion from the US in the Revolutionary War?
When was the battle of Sorotoga fought?
What Prussian expatriate helped not train the Continental army?
What two African countries entered the Revolutionary War against Britain?
What advantage did Britain win when the European countries entered the war?

context: The British, for their part, lacked both a unified command and a clear strategy for winning. With the use of the Royal Navy, the British were able to capture coastal cities, but control of the countryside eluded them. A British sortie from Canada in <a1_0>1777<a1_0/> ended with the disastrous surrender of a British army at <a0_0><b5_0>Saratoga<b5_0/><a0_0/>. With the coming in <b6_0>1777<b6_0/> of <a2_0><b7_0>General von Steuben<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the training and discipline along Prussian lines began, and the Continental Army began to evolve into a modern force. <a3_0><b8_0>France and Spain<b8_0/><a3_0/> then entered the war against Great Britain as Allies of the US, ending <a4_0>its <b9_0>naval advantage<b9_0/><a4_0/> and escalating the conflict into a world war. The Netherlands later joined France, and the British were outnumbered on land and sea in a world war, as they had no major allies apart from Indian tribes.
